items.title: Roman domination in weighted graphs
items.authors: Martín Cera, Pedro García-Vázquez, Juan Carlos Valenzuela-Tripodoro
items.institution: Universidad de Sevilla, Universidad de Cádiz
items.contributions: 1. Initiated the study of the weighted Roman domination number in weighted graphs, establishing several bounds for this new parameter. 2. Presented various realizability results and determined the exact values of the weighted Roman domination number for several well-known graph families. 3. Demonstrated an equivalence between the weighted Roman domination number and the differential of a weighted graph.
items.summary: This paper introduces the concept of weighted Roman domination for vertex-weighted graphs, extending the classical Roman domination number. The authors establish bounds, realizability results, exact values for specific graph families, and prove an equivalence to the graph differential. The work is motivated by applications in bioinformatics where weighted graphs model biomolecular structures.
items.mindmap:
graph TB
        A[Roman domination in weighted graphs] --> B(核心问题/Problem)
        A --> C(主要方法/Method)
        A --> D(关键结果/Results)
        B --> B1(扩展经典罗马支配到带权图/Extend classical Roman domination to weighted graphs)
        C --> C1(定义带权罗马支配数/Define weighted Roman domination number)
        C --> C2(建立边界与可实现性结果/Establish bounds and realizability results)
        D --> D1(计算特定图族的精确值/Compute exact values for specific graph families)
        D --> D2(证明与带权图微分的等价性/Prove equivalence to weighted graph differential)

items.title: Learning with the $p$-adics
items.institution: Instituto Superior Técnico, Universidade de Lisboa; Instituto de Telecomunicações
items.contributions: 1. Proposes using the p-adic number field (Q_p) as an alternative to real numbers for machine learning, leveraging its ultrametric and hierarchical structure. 2. Develops foundational building blocks for classification, regression, and representation learning models and algorithms within the p-adic framework. 3. Demonstrates a novel application by representing simple Quillian semantic networks as compact p-adic linear networks, which is not achievable with real numbers.
items.summary: This paper explores using p-adic numbers, an ultrametric and non-archimedean field, as an alternative to real numbers for machine learning. It introduces theoretical models and algorithms for classification, regression, and representation learning, showing that p-adics enable compact representations of hierarchical structures like semantic networks. The work opens new research directions by leveraging the unique geometric properties of p-adic spaces.
items.mindmap:
graph TB
    A[Learning with the p-adics] --> B(核心问题/Problem)
    A --> C(主要方法/Method)
    A --> D(关键结果/Results)
    B --> B1[现有ML基于实数域/Existing ML uses real numbers]
    B --> B2[是否可用其他域?/Alternative fields possible?]
    C --> C1[研究p-adic数域/Study p-adic number field Q_p]
    C --> C2[利用超度量结构/Exploit ultrametric structure]
    D --> D1[构建分类回归模型/Build classification & regression models]
    D --> D2[表示学习与语义网络/Representation learning & semantic networks]
    D --> D3[开启新研究方向/Open new research directions]

items.title: Computing parameters that generalize interval graphs using restricted modular partitions
items.authors: Flavia Bonomo-Braberman, Eric Brandwein, Ignasi Sau
items.institution: Universidad de Buenos Aires, CONICET, LIRMM (Université de Montpellier, CNRS)
items.contributions: 1. Presents a linear kernel for the Thinness problem parameterized by the interval-modular cardinality. 2. Provides an FPT algorithm for the Simultaneous Interval Number problem parameterized by the cluster-modular cardinality plus the solution size. 3. Establishes negative results, showing that no polynomial kernels exist for Thinness and Simultaneous Interval Number when parameterized by various width parameters (e.g., treewidth, pathwidth) under standard complexity assumptions.
items.summary: This paper analyzes the parameterized complexity of computing two graph parameters, thinness and simultaneous interval number, which generalize interval graphs. It proposes new algorithms parameterized by modular cardinality measures, achieving a linear kernel for Thinness and an FPT algorithm for Simultaneous Interval Number. The results also imply new FPT algorithms for these problems when parameterized by well-known measures like neighborhood diversity and vertex cover number, while showing that polynomial kernels are unlikely for many other common parameters.
items.mindmap:
graph TB
        Root[Computing parameters that generalize interval graphs using restricted modular partitions] --> Problem
        Root --> Method
        Root --> Results
        Problem[核心问题/Problem] --> P1[计算推广区间图的参数 / Computing parameters generalizing interval graphs]
        P1 --> P2[分析薄度与同时区间数的复杂度 / Analyzing complexity of thinness and simultaneous interval number]
        Method[主要方法/Method] --> M1[使用限制模划分 / Using restricted modular partitions]
        M1 --> M2[参数化: 区间模基数, 簇模基数 / Parameterized by interval-modular, cluster-modular cardinality]
        Results[关键结果/Results] --> R1[薄度的线性核 / Linear kernel for Thinness]
        Results --> R2[同时区间数的FPT算法 / FPT algorithm for Simultaneous Interval Number]
        Results --> R3[对多种宽度参数的无多项式核 / No polynomial kernels for many width parameters]

items.title: A Deterministic Bicriteria Approximation Algorithm for the Art Gallery Problem
items.institution: Khalifa University of Science and Technology
items.contributions: 1. Provides a deterministic bicriteria approximation algorithm for the art gallery problem with holes, 2. Achieves a solution size of O(OPT * log(h+2) * log(OPT * log(h+2))) that sees (1-δ) of the polygon's area, 3. Runs in time polynomial in the number of holes, vertices, vertex bit-length, and log(1/δ).
items.summary: This paper presents a deterministic algorithm for the art gallery problem in polygons with holes. The algorithm finds a set of guards whose size is within a polylogarithmic factor of the optimum, and these guards collectively see at least a (1-δ) fraction of the polygon's area. The running time is polynomial in the relevant input parameters.
items.mindmap:
graph TB
        A[A Deterministic Bicriteria Approximation Algorithm for the Art Gallery Problem] --> B[核心问题/Problem: 在带洞多边形中找到最小的点集，使得多边形内所有点都可见]
        A --> C[主要方法/Method: 确定性算法，基于集合覆盖和ε-net理论]
        A --> D[关键结果/Results: 找到规模为O(OPT·log(h+2)·log(OPT·log(h+2)))的点集，覆盖至少(1-δ)面积，运行时间多项式]

items.title: Circle graphs can be recognized in linear time
items.institution: CNRS, Université Montpellier; University of Passau
items.contributions: 1. Demonstrates that the PC-tree data structure can be used to avoid the union-find data structure for split decomposition in the specific context of circle graphs. 2. Achieves a linear-time computation of the split decomposition for circle graphs, improving upon the previous almost linear-time algorithm. 3. Provides the first linear-time recognition algorithm for the class of circle graphs as a direct consequence of the improved decomposition.
items.summary: This paper addresses the problem of recognizing circle graphs efficiently. The authors propose using the PC-tree data structure to compute the split decomposition for circle graphs in linear time, avoiding the slower union-find approach. As a result, they achieve the first linear-time algorithm for circle graph recognition.
items.mindmap:
graph TB
        A[Circle graphs can be recognized in linear time] --> B[核心问题/Problem: Best recognition algorithm runs in almost linear time]
        A --> C[主要方法/Method: Use PC-tree to avoid union-find for split decomposition]
        A --> D[关键结果/Results: First linear-time recognition algorithm for circle graphs]

items.title: Coloring Hardness on Low Twin-Width Graphs
items.institution: Univ Lyon, CNRS, ENS de Lyon, Université Claude Bernard Lyon 1, LIP UMR5668
items.contributions: 1. Proves that the Min Coloring problem is NP-hard on the class of graphs with twin-width at most 3 (T3). 2. Proves that for every k >= 3, the k-Coloring problem is NP-hard on the class of graphs with twin-width at most 4 (T4). 3. Provides structural observations about the T3 and T4 classes, highlighting their distinct properties and raising open questions about complexity transitions.
items.summary: This paper studies the computational complexity of graph coloring problems on graphs with low twin-width. It proves that Min Coloring is NP-hard on graphs of twin-width at most 3, and that k-Coloring is NP-hard on graphs of twin-width at most 4 for all k>=3. These results establish the first hardness for a problem on T3 that is easy on simpler graph classes like trees and cographs.
items.mindmap:
graph TB
    A[Coloring Hardness on Low Twin-Width Graphs] --> B[核心问题/Problem: Coloring complexity on bounded twin-width graphs]
    A --> C[主要方法/Method: NP-hardness proofs via reductions]
    A --> D[关键结果/Results: Min Coloring hard on T3, k-Coloring hard on T4]

items.title: Fast algorithm for $S$-packing coloring of Halin graphs
items.institution: School of Mathematics and Statistics, Xidian University
items.contributions: 1. Studies the S-packing coloring problem specifically for Halin graphs with maximum degree at most 5, 2. Presents a linear-time algorithm that constructs a (1,1,2,2,2)-packing coloring for any such Halin graph, 3. Notes the existence of Halin graphs that are not (1,2,2,2)-packing colorable, establishing the necessity of the specific sequence.
items.summary: This paper addresses the S-packing coloring problem for Halin graphs with maximum degree ≤5. It proposes a linear-time algorithm that successfully constructs a (1,1,2,2,2)-packing coloring for any graph in this class. The work demonstrates that this specific coloring sequence is both sufficient and, in some cases, necessary for these graphs.
items.mindmap:
graph TB
        A[Fast algorithm for S-packing coloring of Halin graphs] --> B(核心问题/Problem)
        A --> C(主要方法/Method)
        A --> D(关键结果/Results)
        B --> B1[S-packing coloring for Halin graphs with Δ≤5]
        C --> C1[Linear-time algorithm]
        C --> C2[Constructs (1,1,2,2,2)-coloring]
        D --> D1[Algorithm works for all such Halin graphs]
        D --> D2[Some graphs are not (1,2,2,2)-colorable]

items.title: Exact rainbow numbers of cycle-related graphs in multi-hubbed wheels
items.institution: Xidian University
items.contributions: 1. Determined the exact rainbow number rb(G,H) for multi-hubbed wheel graphs G and chorded cycle graphs H, providing explicit formulas for several parameter cases. 2. Solved open problems proposed by Jakhar, Budden, and Moun (2025) concerning rainbow numbers of large cycles and chorded cycles in standard wheel graphs. 3. Generalized a previous result by Lan, Shi, and Song (2019) by completely determining rainbow numbers for cycles of arbitrary length in large wheel graphs.
items.summary: This paper studies the rainbow number problem in graph theory. It provides exact formulas for the rainbow number rb(W_d(s), θ_\{t,ℓ\}), where the host graph is a multi-hubbed wheel and the target subgraph is a cycle with chords. The results solve specific open problems and generalize prior work on cycles in wheel graphs.
items.mindmap:
graph TB Root(”Exact rainbow numbers of cycle-related graphs in multi-hubbed wheels
多轮毂轮图中圈相关图的精确彩虹数”) --> Problem Root --> Method Root --> Results Problem(”核心问题/Problem
Determine rb(G,H) for G=W_d(s), H=θ_{t,ℓ}”) Method(”主要方法/Method
Combinatorial analysis and formula derivation”) Results(”关键结果/Results
Exact formulas for rb(W_d(s), θ_{t,ℓ}) in four cases”)

items.title: Proper conflict-free choosability of planar graphs
items.institution: Xidian University
items.contributions: 1. Confirmed a conjecture (k=2) for three specific graph classes: K4-minor-free graphs with max degree ≤4, outer-1-planar graphs with max degree ≤4, and planar graphs with girth ≥12. 2. Confirmed a more general conjecture (existence of an absolute constant k) for the same three classes and additionally for all outer-1-planar graphs without degree constraints. 3. Proved that planar graphs with girth ≥12 and outer-1-planar graphs are proper conflict-free 6-choosable.
items.summary: This paper studies proper conflict-free list coloring of graphs, addressing two conjectures by Kashima, Škrekovski, and Xu. The authors prove these conjectures for several classes of planar and related graphs, including K4-minor-free graphs, outer-1-planar graphs, and planar graphs with high girth. They also establish specific choosability bounds, such as proving these graph classes are proper conflict-free 6-choosable.
items.mindmap:
graph TB Root(”Proper conflict-free choosability of planar graphs
平面图的无冲突可选性”) --> Problem(”核心问题/Problem”) Root --> Method(”主要方法/Method”) Root --> Results(”关键结果/Results”) Problem --> P1(”验证关于无冲突(度数+k)-可选性的两个猜想
Verify two conjectures on proper conflict-free (degree+k)-choosability”) Method --> M1(”图论与组合证明技术
Graph-theoretic and combinatorial proof techniques”) Results --> R1(”对三个图类证实了k=2的猜想
Confirmed k=2 conjecture for three graph classes”) Results --> R2(”对相同图类及外1-平面图证实了存在绝对常数k的猜想
Confirmed existence of absolute constant k for same classes and all outer-1-planar graphs”) Results --> R3(”证明了特定图类是6-可选的
Proved specific graph classes are proper conflict-free 6-choosable”)

items.title: Two-colorings of finite grids: variations on a theorem of Tibor Gallai
items.institution: University of Bucharest, Simion Stoilow Institute of Mathematics of the Romanian Academy
items.contributions: 1. Computed or confirmed the minimal grid sizes (m) for which no 2-coloring can avoid a monochromatic homothetic copy of specific shapes like equilateral triangles, squares, and various rectangles. 2. Extended Gallai's problem from homothety to general similarity, including special rotations, and computed similarity numbers for lattice rectangles of dimensions 1×k for k=2,3,4. 3. Applied and demonstrated the effectiveness of modern SAT solvers combined with symmetry breaking techniques to solve computationally intensive combinatorial geometry problems.
items.summary: This paper investigates a combinatorial geometry problem derived from Gallai's theorem, focusing on finding the smallest grid where any 2-coloring must contain a monochromatic homothetic or similar copy of a given shape. The authors solve these problems by formulating them as propositional satisfiability (SAT) problems and using modern SAT solvers with symmetry breaking. They provide specific numerical results for triangles, squares, and rectangles, and establish new lower bounds for hexagons and 3D cubes.
items.mindmap:
graph TB
        A[Two-colorings of finite grids: variations on a theorem of Tibor Gallai] --> B(核心问题/Problem)
        A --> C(主要方法/Method)
        A --> D(关键结果/Results)
        B --> B1[寻找避免单色相似图形的最大网格尺寸 / Find maximal grid size avoiding monochromatic similar shapes]
        C --> C1[将问题编码为SAT可满足性问题 / Encode problem as SAT satisfiability]
        C --> C2[使用SAT求解器与对称性破缺技术 / Use SAT solvers with symmetry breaking]
        D --> D1[计算特定形状的Gallai相似数 / Compute Gallai similarity numbers for specific shapes]
        D --> D2[为六边形和立方体提供新下界 / Provide new lower bounds for hexagons and cubes]

items.title: Identifying faulty edges in resistive electrical networks
items.institution: Johns Hopkins University
items.contributions: 1. Formalizes a novel problem of identifying faulty edges in resistive networks using effective resistance measurements. 2. Proves rigorous upper and lower bounds on the optimal number of measurements for various graph classes. 3. Demonstrates that the proposed measurement strategies are optimal for several graph classes, as the bounds are tight.
items.summary: The paper studies the problem of identifying faulty resistors in an electrical network by measuring effective resistances between node pairs. The authors propose strategies to minimize the number of such measurements needed for diagnosis. They prove tight upper and lower bounds on this number for different graph classes, establishing the optimality of their approach.
items.mindmap:
graph TB
        Root(Identifying faulty edges in resistive electrical networks) --> Problem(核心问题/Problem)
        Root --> Method(主要方法/Method)
        Root --> Results(关键结果/Results)
        Problem --> P1(诊断电阻网络中的故障边/Diagnose faulty edges in a resistive network)
        Method --> M1(测量节点对间的有效电阻/Measure effective resistance between node pairs)
        Results --> R1(证明测量次数的最优上下界/Prove optimal upper and lower bounds on measurements)
        Results --> R2(对多个图类策略是最优的/Strategies are optimal for several graph classes)

items.title: First-Order Logic and Twin-Width for Some Geometric Graphs
items.authors: Colin Geniet, Gunwoo Kim, Lucas Meijer
items.institution: Institute for Basic Science (IBS), KAIST, Utrecht University
items.contributions: 1. Proved that delineation (the equivalence between tractable FO model checking and bounded twin-width) holds for intersection graphs of non-degenerate axis-parallel unit segments. 2. Showed that delineation fails for visibility graphs of 1.5D terrains. 3. Proved delineation for intersection graphs of circular arcs.
items.summary: This paper investigates the relationship between tractable first-order (FO) logic model checking and the graph parameter twin-width for specific geometric graph classes. It answers open questions by proving this equivalence (delineation) holds for intersection graphs of axis-parallel unit segments and circular arcs, but fails for visibility graphs of 1.5D terrains. The work leverages the theory of twin-width for ordered graphs, exploiting natural vertex orderings in geometric representations.
items.mindmap:
graph TB
        A[First-Order Logic and Twin-Width for Some Geometric Graphs] --> B(核心问题/Problem)
        A --> C(主要方法/Method)
        A --> D(关键结果/Results)
        B --> B1(几何图类的FO模型检查复杂性/FO Model Checking Complexity for Geometric Graph Classes)
        C --> C1(利用有序图的双宽理论/Using Twin-width Theory for Ordered Graphs)
        D --> D1(证明轴平行单位线段图与圆弧图存在描绘/Prove Delineation for Axis-Parallel Unit Segment & Circular Arc Graphs)
        D --> D2(证明1.5D地形可见性图不存在描绘/Prove Delineation Fails for 1.5D Terrain Visibility Graphs)

items.title: Fairness in the k-Server Problem
items.authors: Mohammadreza Daneshvaramoli, Helia Karisani, Mohammad Hajiesmaili, Shahin Kamali, Cameron Musco
items.institution: University of Massachusetts Amherst, York University
items.contributions: 1. Introduced a formal notion of (α, β)-fairness for the k-server problem, aiming to equitably distribute movement costs among servers. 2. Provided deterministic and randomized algorithms that transform optimal/competitive solutions into fair ones with minimal cost increase in offline and online (oblivious adversary) settings. 3. Analyzed the fairness properties of classic algorithms like Double Coverage Algorithm (DCA) and FIFO on specific metrics (line, tree, uniform), showing both positive and negative results.
items.summary: This paper formally studies fairness in the k-server problem, introducing a new fairness metric and algorithms to achieve it. The authors show fairness can be added to both offline and online solutions with minimal performance loss against an oblivious adversary, and analyze the fairness of classic deterministic algorithms on specific metric spaces.
items.mindmap:
graph LR
    A[Fairness in the k-Server Problem] --> B[核心问题/Problem: 如何在k-server问题中公平分配服务器移动成本?]
    A --> C[主要方法/Method: 定义(α, β)-公平性; 设计算法将最优/竞争性解转化为公平解]
    A --> D[关键结果/Results: 离线和在线(非适应性对手)设置下可公平且保持竞争力; DCA在特定度量下公平]
